fi.tamk.cgeng.tiles

Class TileMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tamk.cgeng.tiles.TileMap

  • public class TileMap
extends java.lang.Object
    TileMap is map of tiles. Map is used to draw tiles from TileSet to correct locations using Tiles id information.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TileMap(int[][] tileMap, TileSet tileSet)
      Constructor that initializes tileMap and tileSet attributes.
      TileMap(java.lang.String path, int width, int height, TileSet tileSet)
      Constructor that loads tileMap from file and initializes tileSet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Paints whole tileSet to screen.
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g, GameCam cam)
      Paints only tiles which given GameCam is looking at.
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Paints whole tileSet to screen, developer is able to move all the tiles with xOffset and yOffset parameters.
      void setTileMap(int[][] tileMap)
      Changes tileMap.
      void setTileSet(TileSet tileSet)
      Changes tileSet.
      Tile tileAt(int x, int y)
      Returns tile at tileMap's [x][y]
      Tile tileAtCoord(int x, int y)
      Returns tile at coordinate(in pixels).

        public TileMap(java.lang.String path,
               int width,
               int height,
               TileSet tileSet)

        Parameters:
        path - path of file
        width - tileMaps width in tiles
        height - tileMaps height in tiles
        tileSet - tileSet where tiles info is taken.

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints whole tileSet to screen.
        Parameters:
        g - map is rendered by Graphics class

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  int xOffset,
                  int yOffset)
        Paints whole tileSet to screen, developer is able to move all the tiles with xOffset and yOffset parameters.
        Parameters:
        g - map is rendered by Garphics class
        xOffset - how much tiles are moved left
        yOffset - how much tiles are moved to up

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  GameCam cam)
        Paints only tiles which given GameCam is looking at. Called by default in GameCam's paint method.
        Parameters:
        g - map is rendered by Garphics class
        cam - GameCam that you are using

      • setTileSet

        Parameters:
        tileMap - new TileMap

      • tileAt

        public Tile tileAt(int x,
                   int y)
        Returns tile at tileMap's [x][y]
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of tileMap
        y - y coordinate of tileMap

      • tileAtCoord

        public Tile tileAtCoord(int x,
                        int y)
        Returns tile at coordinate(in pixels).
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate in pixels
        y - y coordinate in pixels
